basics.name: Liliya Vildanova
basics.label: Web Developer
basics.summary: Web Developer with 10+ years of CMS expertise, specializing in pixel-perfect WordPress migrations, responsive front-end buildouts, and performance-tuned UX. Passionate about clean code, seamless design fidelity, and driving business impact through optimized, user-centered solutions.

work.name: The Printing House
work.summary: Led complex WordPress migrations, custom theme development, and front-end optimizations for high-traffic marketing sites.
highlights: Migrated 200+ pages from legacy CMS into WordPress with 100% design and content fidelity
Built custom PHP/ACF themes and Tailwind-CSS templates to mirror existing Lovably-style layouts
Integrated and configured Yoast SEO, Gravity Forms, and WooCommerce for enhanced functionality
Translated Figma and Photoshop mockups into responsive, cross-browser templates (Chrome, Firefox, Safari)

work.name: The Printing House
work.summary: Executed platform migrations, e-commerce integrations, and front-end feature builds for print and web products.
highlights: Ported 50+ microsites from page builders into in-house WordPress instances, cutting build times by 40%
Developed interactive components (sliders, lightboxes, accordions) using vanilla JS and jQuery
Optimized site performance via image lazy-loading, asset minification, and CDN integration
Collaborated with design and marketing teams to implement UI/UX refinements and A/B tests

work.name: Marathon Realty Inc. & Entro Communications
work.summary: Supported creative teams by producing web and print mockups and early-stage responsive prototypes.
highlights: Designed high-fidelity mockups and visual assets in Adobe Photoshop
Prototyped responsive email and landing-page templates in HTML/CSS
Collaborated on environmental and app design briefs

work.name: Nizhnekamskneftekhim
work.summary: Engineered and optimized industrial automation systems with PLC programming and HMI interfaces.
highlights: Programmed PLC logic and SCADA dashboards for production-line control
Streamlined operator interfaces, reducing error rates by 25%
Led integration testing and troubleshooting of complex machinery workflows
